justification: Neglects Team B’s conservative, volume-first mindset. It asks them to give up Ryan Taylor, a Tier 1 workhorse they highly value, for two boom-bust deep-threat WRs and a doubtful committee RB—poor fit for their floor preference and consensus rankings. Requesting Lucas Carter to “add a dual-threat QB” ignores that he’s Out, offering no short-term value. The rationale focuses on A’s surplus/needs, not B’s incentives or roster gaps. Structurally feasible but contextually implausible and weakly reasoned.
